Understanding Flexbox

Easier layouts in CSS! These are some important properties jotted down so it would be best if you follow the course on educative.io, which I credited at the very bottom! Start using flexbox by setting the parent element's display to flex or inline-flex.

ul {
  display: flex; /*or inline-flex*/
}
  • Flex container: the parent element in which flex items are contained
  • Flex item(s): the child/children of the flex-container

Flex Container Properties

Flex Direction

  • Main axis = Horizontal
  • Cross axis = Vertical
ul {
  flex-direction: row || column || row-reverse || column-reverse;
}
  • Row = main axis (default)
  • Column = cross axis

Flex Wrap

ul {
  flex-wrap: wrap || no-wrap || wrap-reverse;
  }

Flex Flow

ul {
	flex-flow: row wrap; /*direction 'row' and yes, please wrap the items.*/
}
  • Flex flow takes flex direction and flex wrap values

Justify conotent

  • How to align on the main axis
ul {
	justify-content: flex-start || flex-end || center || space-between || space-around
}

Align items

  • How to align on the cross axis
ul {
	align-items: flex-start || flex-end || center || stretch || baseline
}

Align Content

  • How to align for multi-line flexbox
ul {
	align-content: flex-start || flex-end || center || stretch || baseline
}

Flex Item Properties

Order

  • Can reorder items in container
li:nth-child(1) {
			order: 1
		}

Flex grow/ flex shrink

  • For extra space
  • Set to 1 to turn on
  • By default flex shrink is set to 1
li {
	flex-grow: 1;
}

Flex basis

  • Set the width of the flexbox manually
li {
	flex-basis: 150px;
}

Shorthand

li:nth-child(1) {
	flex: 2 1 0; /*same as just writing flex: 2*/
}

Align-self

li:first-of-type {
	align-self: auto || flex-start || flex-end || center || baseline || stretch
}

Auto-margin Alignment

  • When margin:auto on flex item, the direction that has the value auto will take up all of the empty space

Flex direction

  • Change to Japanese style (main axis and cross axis flips)
ul {
  	flex-direction: column;
}
